meanings.definition: More attractive or beautiful than something else.
meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden are lovelier than the ones in the vase.
meanings.sent2: She thought the sunset was lovelier than any painting she had seen.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's attempt at singing was lovelier than his howling.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was lovelier than a field of blooming daisies.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song was lovelier than a gentle breeze on a summer day.

meanings.definition: In a more pleasing or enjoyable manner.
meanings.sent1: She sang lovelier than the birds in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The children played together lovelier than they did yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The cat purred lovelier than a contented lion.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed lovelier than a dancer gracefully moving.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the room lovelier than any perfume.
